intro: Schwenckia mandonii, commonly known as the golden cupflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-centered, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a velvety texture. Schwenckia mandonii is often found in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and prairies.
